intro: Chaboissaea decumbens, commonly known as the creeping chaboissaea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is a low-growing, herbaceous species that typically spreads along the ground, forming dense mats. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and they bloom in clusters. Chaboissaea decumbens is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
